extDescription.message: A persistent sidebar for Chrome, with tree-style tabs, branching tab histories, bookmarks bar, and more.

prompt_detectMonitors.message: Sidewise will detect your monitor(s) now.

prompt_detectMonitors_mac.message:
Sidewise will detect your monitor details now.

Unfortunately, Sidewise currently cannot detect multiple monitors properly on Mac OSX. Sidewise will assume you only have a single monitor.

option_keepSidebarOnTop.message: Keep sidebar visible next to dock window

option_keepSidebarOnTop_hint.message:
!If enabled, when switching to Chrome from another app, Sidewise will bring the sidebar to the front, so other windows don't obscure or hide it.

Unfortunately, this messes with the OS's window-ordering. For example, on Windows, you'll have to Alt-Tab twice to get back to your last non-Chrome window when this option is enabled.

option_browserActionButtonBehavior.message: When browser toolbar button is clicked

option_dockState.message: Dock sidebar to this side of the window

optionsMonitorDetectionInfo.message:
Whenever you change your monitor configuration, reload Chrome, then come here and click 'Detect all monitors now' below.

This should be done whenever you add or remove monitors, change monitor resolutions, reposition monitors in your OS settings, or change the location/size of your system taskbars.

option_loggingEnabled.message: Enable debug logging in background page

optionsSaveNotNeeded.message: Note: Settings are automatically saved as you change them.
